bibl.title: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, [July 22, 1951]

div1.p: Rojas informs Hench that she has read of the Cuban government's plans to make the Camp Lazear memorial another monument to Finlay, and wonders if Hench has abandoned his plans for the memorial or is still working with the government. She offers her help and hopes his ideas will be carried out.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, [July 22, 1951] (See Spanish original.)
div1.opener:
Letter to Dr. P. Hench from M. T. Rojas
Dear Dr Hench:
div1.p:
Several months ago, on reading in “La Prensa”
of the high and deserved honor of which you
had been the object, I wrote you congralutating
you and telling you how happy we were to see
your efforts so justly rewarded.

As I have not received further news from
you, I don't know whether the letter reached
your hands or whether you were on a trip and
did not receive it.

In it I also spoke to you of the surprise I
received on learning - likewise through “La Prensa”-
of the interpretation which the government gave
to your wise plans concerning Camp Lazear,
convirting them into one more monument to Dr.
Finlay, who already has so many! And I sent
you several clippings from newspapers that spoke
of the matter.

It would interest me to know if you have
had to desist from carrying out all that beautiful
plan which one proposed doing and if Lazear will
remain in oblivion, or if you are continuing to
work in accordance with the guardianship which
they have formed.

As always I offer my help in any degree
possible to me and I would be very happy if you
could realize (carry out), if not all, at least a
part of your original plan.

Our most affectionate regards to Mrs. Hench, for
we are always talking of the pleasant times we
had in her company.
Hoping to hear from you soon,
